no.steria.osgi.jsr330activator.implementation

Interface Injection

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    InjectionBase, InjectionField, InjectionMethod

    interface Injection
    Defines an injection point in a provider class. Called from the bundle activator (or actually, from a listener callback), when the service becomes available.
    Author:
    Steinar Bang

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void doInject(Object service)
      Set the value of the injection point.
      void doRetract(Object service)
      Unset the injected value, if this is the same object that was originally injected.
      Class<?> getInjectedServiceType()
      Get the type of the injected service
      boolean isInjected()
      Used to determine if the injection point is currently in an injected state.
      void setupListener(org.osgi.framework.BundleContext bundleContext, ProviderAdapter providerAdapter)
      Will set up an OSGi listener for the injected service, so that it will be injected when the service appears in OSGi and retracted when the service disappears from OSGi.
      void unGet(org.osgi.framework.BundleContext context)
      Release this injection when stopping the provider.

    • Method Detail

      • getInjectedServiceType

        Class<?> getInjectedServiceType()
        Get the type of the injected service
        Returns:
        a class object defining the injected service.

      • isInjected

        boolean isInjected()
        Used to determine if the injection point is currently in an injected state.
        Returns:
        true if this injection has been set to a valid value

      • doInject

        void doInject(Object service)
        Set the value of the injection point. If the value can't be set for any reason, the method is a no-op.
        Parameters:
        service - a valid OSGi service that is of the correct type for the injection.

      • doRetract

        void doRetract(Object service)
        Unset the injected value, if this is the same object that was originally injected. If this is false or if the operation fails, the method is a no-op. Called when receiving an unregistration event about the service.
        Parameters:
        service - the service to retract

      • setupListener

        void setupListener(org.osgi.framework.BundleContext bundleContext,
                 ProviderAdapter providerAdapter)
        Will set up an OSGi listener for the injected service, so that it will be injected when the service appears in OSGi and retracted when the service disappears from OSGi.
        Parameters:
        bundleContext - the object to register the listener with
        providerAdapter - the object to notify after an injection has been received and set

      • unGet

        void unGet(org.osgi.framework.BundleContext context)
        Release this injection when stopping the provider.
        Parameters:
        context -
